page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Sturminster Newton and the surrounding villages are full of historical facts.In Hinton St.Mary,Mr. White,a local farmer accidentally found a Roman mosaic.It was inlaid with a picture of Jesus,perhaps the first known picture in England!Made in AD 315, the mosaic was found in 1964 and,because of the possibility of there being a whole villa under his land,he is not allowed to build on it. In Sturminster Newton,there are archways for coaches,left in the pub walls. Halfway between Sturminster and Hinton there is a medeival Tythe Barn, used for storing 10% of the farmer's crops,which they had to give to the Church.It is made of stone and thatch. In the centre of Sturminster is the C15th market cross,made of stone.
